theorems.doc_string:
The type `HiggsField` is defined such that elements are smooth sections of the trivial
vector bundle `HiggsBundle`. Such elements are Higgs fields. Since `HiggsField` is
trivial as a vector bundle, a Higgs field is equivalent to a smooth map
from `SpaceTime` to `HiggsVec`.

theorems.type_signature:

  {Q : QuadraticForm R M} {C : CliffordAlgebra Q â†’ Prop},
  (âˆ€ (r : R), C (RingHom.instFunLike.coe (algebraMap R (CliffordAlgebra Q)) r)) â†’
    (âˆ€ (x : M), C (LinearMap.instFunLike.coe (CliffordAlgebra.Î¹ Q) x)) â†’
      (âˆ€ (a b : CliffordAlgebra Q), C a â†’ C b â†’ C (instHMul.hMul a b)) â†’
        (âˆ€ (a b : CliffordAlgebra Q), C a â†’ C b â†’ C (instHAdd.hAdd a b)) â†’ âˆ€ (a : CliffordAlgebra Q), C a
theorems.raw_signature:
âˆ€ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] {M : Type u_2} [inst_1 : AddCommGroup M] [inst_2 : Module R M]
  {Q : QuadraticForm R M} {C : CliffordAlgebra Q â†’ Prop},
  (âˆ€ (r : R), C (RingHom.instFunLike.coe (algebraMap R (CliffordAlgebra Q)) r)) â†’
    (âˆ€ (x : M), C (LinearMap.instFunLike.coe (CliffordAlgebra.Î¹ Q) x)) â†’
      (âˆ€ (a b : CliffordAlgebra Q), C a â†’ C b â†’ C (instHMul.hMul a b)) â†’
        (âˆ€ (a b : CliffordAlgebra Q), C a â†’ C b â†’ C (instHAdd.hAdd a b)) â†’ âˆ€ (a : CliffordAlgebra Q), C a
theorems.doc_string:
If `C` holds for the `algebraMap` of `r : R` into `CliffordAlgebra Q`, the `Î¹` of `x : M`,
and is preserved under addition and multiplication, then it holds for all of `CliffordAlgebra Q`.

See also the stronger `CliffordAlgebra.left_induction` and `CliffordAlgebra.right_induction`.

For an element `P` of `Potential` with `0 < l` and a real `c : â„`, there exists
  a Higgs field `Ï†` and a spacetime point `x` such that `P.toFun Ï† x = c` iff one of the
  following two conditions hold:
- `Î¼2 < 0` and `0 â‰¤ c`. That is, if `l` is positive and `Î¼2` negative, then the potential
  takes every non-negative value.
- or `0 â‰¤ Î¼2` and `- Î¼2 ^ 2 / (4 * ð“µ) â‰¤ c`. That is, if `l` is positive and `Î¼2` non-negative,
  then the potential takes every value greater then or equal to its bound.

  (LinearMap.instFunLike.coe (TensorSpecies.Tensor.contrT 2 1 2 â‹¯)
    (LinearMap.instFunLike.coe

  (LinearMap.instFunLike.coe (TensorSpecies.Tensor.permT (Matrix.vecCons 0 (Matrix.vecCons 1 Matrix.vecEmpty)) â‹¯)
    (EquivLike.toFunLike.coe

theorems.name: cliffordalgebra_forall_mul_self_eq_iff
theorems.type_signature:
âˆ€ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] {M : Type u_2} [inst_1 : AddCommGroup M] [inst_2 : Module R M]
  {Q : QuadraticForm R M} {A : Type u_4} [inst_3 : Ring A] [inst_4 : Algebra R A],
  IsUnit 2 â†’
    âˆ€ (f : LinearMap (RingHom.id R) M A),
      Iff
        (âˆ€ (x : M),
          Eq (instHMul.hMul (LinearMap.instFunLike.coe f x) (LinearMap.instFunLike.coe f x))
            (RingHom.instFunLike.coe (algebraMap R A) (QuadraticMap.instFunLike.coe Q x)))
        (Eq (instHAdd.hAdd (((LinearMap.mul R A).complâ‚‚ f).comp f) (((LinearMap.mul R A).flip.complâ‚‚ f).comp f))
          (LinearMap.comprâ‚‚ (QuadraticMap.polarBilin Q) (Algebra.linearMap R A)))
theorems.raw_signature:
âˆ€ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] {M : Type u_2} [inst_1 : AddCommGroup M] [inst_2 : Module R M]
  {Q : QuadraticForm R M} {A : Type u_4} [inst_3 : Ring A] [inst_4 : Algebra R A],
  IsUnit 2 â†’
    âˆ€ (f : LinearMap (RingHom.id R) M A),
      Iff
        (âˆ€ (x : M),
          Eq (instHMul.hMul (LinearMap.instFunLike.coe f x) (LinearMap.instFunLike.coe f x))
            (RingHom.instFunLike.coe (algebraMap R A) (QuadraticMap.instFunLike.coe Q x)))
        (Eq (instHAdd.hAdd (((LinearMap.mul R A).complâ‚‚ f).comp f) (((LinearMap.mul R A).flip.complâ‚‚ f).comp f))
          (LinearMap.comprâ‚‚ (QuadraticMap.polarBilin Q) (Algebra.linearMap R A)))
theorems.doc_string:
An alternative way to provide the argument to `CliffordAlgebra.lift` when `2` is invertible.

To show a function squares to the quadratic form, it suffices to show that
`f x * f y + f y * f x = algebraMap _ _ (polar Q x y)`

`Rel` relates each `Î¹ m * Î¹ m`, for `m : M`, with `Q m`.
